title: Academic career of former SoC Theory PhD student takes off
content:
Sewon Park, recent Ph.D. graduate of Theoretical Computer Science at KAIST, has given both contributed and invited talks at KMS Fall Meeting, at AAAC'2021, and at international conference CCC'2021. He is now postdoc at Kyoto University.
Sewon Park graduated this summer with a PhD from School of Computing.
He was promptly invited to give a talk at the international conference
https://www.cs.bham.ac.uk/~axj/ccc2021/
He gave contributed talks at KMS Fall Meeting
https://www.kms.or.kr/conference/abstract/search_view.html?num=7977&uid=74
And he gave a contributed talk at the 14th Annual Meeting of the Asian Association for Algorithms and Computation.
http://aaac2021.ie.nthu.edu.tw/index.php/program/
Sewon has just completed quarantine in Japan and is now postdoc at Kyoto University in the group of Akitoshi Kawamura.
https://www.kurims.kyoto-u.ac.jp/~kawamura/ken/
